moves.1. Nf3: This is a team game I lost and my opponent and I discussed annotating it together as practice, so here we go. I'm using Reti, which is an opening I like due to the versatility and flexibility.
moves.1... d5 2. d4 Nf6 3. c4 Nc6 4. Bf4: This was a mistake. e3 was what I should have done, which is pretty obvious in retrospect. This move accomplishes exactly nothing.
moves.4... dxc4 5. Nc3 e6 6. e4: I guess I wanted to leave an escape route for my DSB.
moves.6... Be7 7. Bxc4 Na5 8. Qa4+ Nc6: I feel like I'm in good shape in this position. None of my previous moves have sealed my fate and no one has dominant control of the center yet.
moves.9. h3: Mistake. d5 is the better move as I have more threats on that square and would likely dictate tempo going forward.
moves.9... Bd7 10. Bb5 a6 11. Bxc6 Bxc6 12. Qc: Obviously I made a mistake here. Left the N hanging to protect the B, when I should have just Be3 or Bd2.
moves.14... Bxf3 15. Rg1: My earlier mistake forces another move, which I think I pay for much later on in the game in the form of an exposed K.
moves.15... Qxd4: Central Q will now punish me for not developing better. It's hard to look at mistakes like this next move and figure out what I was thinking when I did it. I blame a combination of moving too fast, playing at work, and playing too many games.
moves.16. Be3: Really, though, this was stupid carelessness. Have a pawn, I'm done using it.
moves.16... Qxe5 17. g4: Want to see another smart move? Looking at it now, I guess I never wanted to win. I can't even find a decent move here with all of his forces joining up on my side of the line.
moves.17... Qh2: I think you could argue this was a mistake, with perhaps a trade like Nf4 being better and then working toward bringing the DSB into the fray via 17. ... Nf4 18. Bxf4 Qxf4 19. ... Bc5.
moves.18. Kd2 Qxh3: This was definitely a mistake, but I have no real means of capitalizing any more than gxh5.
moves.19. gxh5 Bxh5 20. Bh6: I'm desperate here and this just ends up keeping my B and R both occupied for no good reason. He's got me boxed out from getting my Q to g7.
moves.20... Rad8+: This is a critical move for black and the beginning of the end for me.
moves.21. Ke1 Bf6: I knew he saw it already, but this cements it.
